data.title: The Official Long Ryders Online Store.
data.meta_description: The Long Ryders official online store for T-shirts, Tour Posters, CDs and DVDs
data.text:
Native Sons Expanded 3CD Edition

This new 3CD edition compiled in conjunction with founding member Sid Griffin contains the original album alongside a raft of demos and a blistering live show from London in ’85.

Described at the time by Melody Maker as a “Modern American Classic” this version brings together all the tracks that defined the start of Alt Country.

September November

September November is the first album in four years from the band who helped invent Alt-country and Americana, the follow up the critically acclaimed Psychedelic Country Soul.

September November is released on LP, CD and Digital and is available direct from Cherry Red Records

The Long Ryders – State Of Our Reunion Live 2004 DVD (SIDVID022)

For their first live gigs in seventeen years the Long Ryders kicked ass and took names and you can see the results on this stellar recording from the London gig. Cut on a hot summer night the sold out venue turned punters away and the result was a classic live album which can be filed next to Get Your Ya-Ya’s Out, Live At The Apollo or Kick Out The Jams.

Featuring the classic lineup of ex-Jayhawk Stephen McCarthy, Indiana state senator Tom Stevens, publishing mogul Greg Sowders and Dylan author Sid Griffin. Included as extras is some footage of the band live in the UK in March 1985 as well as larkin’ about in the A&M Studios with Ed Stasium in autumn 1986!

£9 including P&P (UK customers)

£11 including P&P (Rest of World)

Lights Of Downtown / You Don’t Know What’s Right, You Don’t Know What’s Wrong / A Stitch In Time/Prairie Fire / Wreck Of The 809 / Gunslinger Man / Years Long Ago / I Can’t Hide / Ivory Tower / Capturing The Flag / Band Introduction (Glasgow) / I Had A Dream / Final Wild Son / (Sweet) Mental Revenge / State Of Our Union / Looking For Lewis & Clark / Louisville / 10-5-60
